intro: Dichromena hispidula, commonly known as the hairy dichromena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink and are arranged in clusters. Dichromena hispidula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks.
